Waspada Ledakan Populasi Nyamuk DBD di Awal 2020!
07 Nov 2019, 13:27 by Hilmi Abdul Halim
PURWAKARTA, (PR). Jumlah penderita Demam Berdarah Dengue (DBD) di Kabupaten Purwakarta terus meningkat. Selama Januari-September 2019 saja, Dinas Kesehatan setempat mencatat jumlah penderita DBD mencapai 492 orang.
Kepala Seksi Pencegahan dan Pengendalian Penyakit Menular, Meisera membandingkannya dengan dua tahun sebelumnya. "Pada 2017 jumlahnya 122 orang, 2018 ada 263. Tapi di 2019 sampai September sudah 492 orang," katanya, Kamis 7 November 2019.
Kondisi itu dipicu oleh kondisi cuaca dengan intensitas hujan yang tinggi. Apabila tidak diantisipasi secepatnya, jumlah populasi nyamuk Aedes aegypti pembawa penyakit DBD dikhawatirkan meledak pada awal 2020. "Ledakan populasi nyamuk itu merupakan akumulasi dari sebelumnya. Semacam siklus lima tahunan, itu bisa terjadi tahun depan," ujar Meisera.
Upaya pencegahan penyakit DBD diakui telah dilakukan oleh Pemerintah Kabupaten Purwakarta melalui seluruh Pusat Kesehatan Masyarakat (Puskesmas) yang tersebar di daerahnya. Pemeriksaan Jentik Berkala tersebut dilakukan setiap tiga bulan.
Berdasarkan pantauan  petugas Puskesmas di setiap rumah yang dijadikan sampel, Meisera menyebutkan angka bebas jentiknya masih di bawah minimal 95 persen. "Di kita masih 85 persen angka bebas jentiknya. Itu sudah cukup bagus, tinggal ditingkatkan kesadaran masyarakatnya," katanya.
Karena itu, Bupati Purwakarta Anne Ratna Mustika mengimbau setiap keluarga memiliki seorang kader Jumantik yang bertanggung jawab untuk rumahnya masing-masing. Secara sederhana, caranya ialah memeriksa jentik yang muncul setiap pekan.
"Untuk mencegahnya, dengan cara menutup tempat penampungan air, menguras tiap pekan, mengubur barang tak terpakai atau kalau bisa mendaur ulang sampah yang masih terpakai," tutur Anne. Selebihnya, masyarakat juga bisa menutup saluran udara dengan penutup anti nyamuk dan menjaga kebersihan.
Menurut laporan Dinas Kesehatan Purwakarta, pertumbuhan nyamuk Aedes aegypti tidak hanya di wilayah pemukiman padat penduduk seperti Kelurahan Munjul, Kecamatan Purwakarta. Sepanjang tahun ini, nyamuk tersebut juga terpantau di Kecamatan Sukatani, Darangdan, Pasawahan hingga Jatiluhur.***

Beware of DHF Mosquito Population Explosion in Early 2020!
Nov 7 2019, 13:27 by Hilmi Abdul Halim
PURWAKARTA, (PR). The number of sufferers of Dengue Hemorrhagic Fever (DHF) in Purwakarta Regency continues to increase. During January-September 2019 alone, the local Health Office recorded the number of DHF sufferers reaching 492 people.
The Head of the Infectious Disease Prevention and Control Section, Meisera compared it to the previous two years. "In 2017 there were 122 people, in 2018 there were 263. But in 2019 until September there were 492 people," he said, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
The condition was triggered by weather conditions with high rainfall intensity. If not anticipated as soon as possible, the number of Aedes aegypti mosquito population carrying dengue is feared to explode in early 2020. "The mosquito population explosion is an accumulation from before. Such a five-year cycle, it can happen next year," said Meisera.
The prevention of DHF prevention has been acknowledged to have been carried out by the Purwakarta Regency Government through all Community Health Centers (Puskesmas) spread throughout its area. Periodic larvae examination is carried out every three months.
Based on the monitoring of Puskesmas staff in each sample house, Meisera said that the larva free rate was still below a minimum of 95 percent. "We are still at 85 percent of the larva free rate. That is good enough, we just need to increase the awareness of the people," he said.
Therefore, Purwakarta Regent Anne Ratna Mustika appealed to each family to have a Jumantik cadre responsible for their respective homes. Simply put, the way is to check the larvae that appear every week.
"To prevent this, by closing water reservoirs, draining every week, burying unused items, or if you can recycle waste that is still in use," said Anne. The rest, the public can also close the airways with mosquito repellent cover and maintain cleanliness.
According to a Purwakarta Health Service report, the growth of Aedes aegypti mosquitoes is not only in densely populated residential areas such as Munjul Village, Purwakarta District. During the year, the mosquitoes were also observed in the Districts of Sukatani, Darangdan, Pasawahan to Jatiluhur. ***
